gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
Spray pan with non stick cooking spray.
Heat milk, water and butter to boiling; stir in contents of both pouches of potatoes; let stand one minute.
Stir in corn.
Spoon half the potato mixture in pan.
Sprinkle half each of cheese and onions; top with remaining potatoes.
Sprinkle with remaining cheese and onions.
Bake 10 to 15 minutes until cheese is melted.
Enjoy !
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the mashed potatoes, milk, water, and butter. Mix until well combined.
3. Add the drained corn, cheese, and French-fried onions to the bowl. Mix until well combined.
4. Transfer the mixture to a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
5. Bake the casserole in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and the center is set.
6. Remove the casserole from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

This Crunchy Onion Potato Bake recipe combines the flavors of mashed potatoes, milk, water, and butter, with the addition of corn, cheese, and French-fried onions. The result is a delicious and satisfying dish that can be enjoyed as a side or main course. The use of a greased baking dish ensures that the casserole cooks evenly and does not stick to the pan.

gt:
ROASTING: preheat oven to 450.
Peel and dice squash into 1/2 inch pieces (see tip at end).
Dice onion into 1/2 inch pieces.
Toss squash and onion with olive oil and spread pieces onto a large flat baking pan.
Season with salt and pepper.
Roast for 20 minutes - add diced apple - and continue roasting another 10-20 minutes (30-40 total roasting time).
Tip: while you are roasting, make some "cheese toasts".
Put some shredded cheese on top of bread rounds (we like gruyere or parmesan).
Bake 10-15 minutes until crispy.
These cheese toasts are fantastic soup toppers!
Place roasted mixture into blender with about half the chicken broth; puree (keep hand on lid because hot liquids can cause the top to "explode" off with built up steam).
Add remaining chicken broth, half-and-half, and herbs; puree.
Transfer mixture to saucepan; reheat gently.
Serve with a dollop of sour cream and croutons.
TIP: to prepare squash, first cut squash in half horizontally.
Place flat end onto cutting board to stabilize squash and use a peeler to remove skin.
Remove seeds.
Then cut into lengths, and then into diced pieces.
NOTE: if you have leftover mashed potatoes from Thanksgiving, add about 1/2 cup, which will thicken the soup and add a nice smoothness.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Cut the butternut squash in half lengthwise, and then cut each half into 4 equal pieces.
3. Place the squash pieces on a baking sheet, and drizzle them with olive oil. Season with salt and pepper.
4. Roast the squash in the preheated oven for about 45 minutes, or until the squash is tender and slightly caramelized.
5. Remove the squash from the oven, and let it cool for a few minutes.
6. In a large saucepan, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion, and cook until it is softened and translucent.
7. Add the apple, and cook for a few more minutes, until it begins to soften.
8. Pour in the chicken broth, and bring the mixture to a simmer.
9. Add the half-and-half, and continue to simmer until the mixture thickens slightly.
10. Remove the saucepan from the heat, and let it cool for a few minutes.
11. In a blender, combine the cooled squash, onion-apple mixture, and the thyme and parsley.
12. Blend the mixture until smooth, and then pour it back into the saucepan.
13. If desired, add a dollop of sour cream to the soup for extra creaminess.
14. Season the soup with salt and pepper to taste.
15. Serve the Butternut Squash Soup or Bisque hot, garnished with croutons if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
If making your own sauce, prepare it the day before you are planning to make the meatloaf.
In a large bowl, combine the first nine ingredients (everything but the lamb/beef and tzatziki sauce).
Crumble lamb or beef over the mixture and combine well.
Shape into a loaf and place in a greased 11x7" baking dish.
Bake uncovered at 350 for 55-60 minutes or until no pink remains and a thermostat reads 160.
Let stand for 15 minutes before slicing.
Drizzle with tzatziki sauce.
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the thawed and squeezed dry spinach, onion, and eggs.
3. Add the grated romano cheese, dried oregano, garlic powder, salt, and all purpose Greek seasoning. Mix well.
4. Add the ground lamb or ground beef to the mixture, and stir to combine.
5. Form the mixture into a loaf shape, about 6 inches in diameter and 3 inches high.
6. Place the loaf on a baking sheet and bake for 45-50 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 160°F (70°C).
7. Allow the loaf to cool for a few minutes before slicing it into 1-inch pieces.
8. While the loaf is baking, prepare the tzatziki sauce by combining the tzatziki, sauce, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
9. Serve the Gyro Meat Loaf with the tzatziki sauce on the side.

This recipe will yield a delicious and satisfying Gyro Meat Loaf that can be enjoyed with the accompanying tzatziki sauce. The combination of the tender meat, flavorful spinach, and the tangy tzatziki sauce creates a delightful and satisfying meal.
